title: Tamworth house fire: 2 dead, including child, after ‘suspicious’ blaze
text:
A child and an elderly woman have died in a house fire in Tamworth, in northern NSW.

A man is being questioned by police following a “suspicious” house fire in Tamworth that killed two people, including a child, and injured another two.

Emergency services were called to the home on Bylong Road, Hilvue, at 5.30am and discovered two bodies inside, one of which is believed to be of an elderly woman.

A woman and child have been rushed to hospital in the north west NSW city.

A woman was taken to Tamworth Base Hospital with serious burns, while a seven year-old child was taken to the same hospital with minor burns and suffering smoke inhalation.

A neighbour told the ABC the family were “lovely”.

“I woke up this morning to use the bathroom to use and realised their house was on fire,” Bernadette Wood said.

“It’s so sad … it’s a tragedy when your house is on fire, there’s nothing you can but stand there and watch,” she said.

A crime scene has been set up and a man is assisting police with their inquiries over the incident. The fire is being treated as suspicious.

— with AAP.
description: A man is being questioned by police following a “suspicious” house fire in Tamworth that killed two people, including a child, and injured another two.
